title: Brexit blow for Boris Johnson after lawmakers defer decision on deal
text:
London (CNN) Boris Johnson suffered yet another Brexit setback as UK lawmakers voted to delay approval of the UK Prime Minister's departure deal until Parliament passes the legislation required to enact it.

Johnson must now ask the EU for an extension to the Brexit process until the end of January, an outcome he has been determined to avoid since he returned in triumph from Brussels with a new deal earlier this week.

Letwin, the MP who proposed the plan, said his amendment was an "insurance policy" to ensure Britain would not "crash out" of the European Union without a deal on October 31. It passed by 322 to 306.

By denying Johnson a straight up-and-down vote on the deal he agreed with the EU earlier this week, the day dubbed as Super Saturday became something of an anti-climax.

In the first weekend sitting of Parliament for 37 years, Johnson had implored MPs from all sides of the House of Commons to back his Brexit deal and support a "shared sense of destiny."

Read More
description: Boris Johnson suffered yet another Brexit setback as UK lawmakers voted to delay approval of the UK Prime Minister's departure deal until Parliament passes the legislation required to enact it.
